messages.text: What is the name of a family of time series filters that sum up values to a specific time over a defined epoch?

elements.text: What is the name of a family of time series filters that sum up values to a specific time over a defined epoch?

messages.text: I thought they were just called summing filters, but I might be wrong - not even sure if a class of filters like this exists...

elements.text: I thought they were just called summing filters, but I might be wrong - not even sure if a class of filters like this exists...

messages.text:
Has anyone used `esprit()` lately?
<https://docs.juliadsp.org/stable/estimation/#DSP.Estimation.esprit>
By documentation it says the model is of `p` Sines, yet even in the simplest case of a model of 2 it only returns one of the frequencies and its negative.
Could it be the model is `p / 2` and the use needs to use only half? Or the model is complex exponent (Hence for real signal both the negative and positive frequencies)?

messages.text:
Yes, but the issue I was pointing is the frequencies it returns doesn't match the model.
The model says `p` sines. So if you generate a signal of 2 sines and use the function you assume you'll get the 2 frequencies.

elements.text:
Yes, but the issue I was pointing is the frequencies it returns doesn't match the model.
The model says
p
sines. So if you generate a signal of 2 sines and use the function you assume you'll get the 2 frequencies.

messages.text: In practice you get the same frequency twice (Negative and positive).

elements.text: In practice you get the same frequency twice (Negative and positive).

messages.text: So either the model is wrong or documentation is wrong.

elements.text: So either the model is wrong or documentation is wrong.

messages.text: If you enter `2p` you will get the correct frequencies (2 positive and 2 negative).

elements.text: If you enter
2p
you will get the correct frequencies (2 positive and 2 negative).

messages.text: I think the model of the `esprit` in Complex Exponent hence if the data is real one should ask for `2p` freqeuncies.
